docs.snippet: Opinion polls published on Sunday in the United States and Germany indicated that a majority of the public were losing trust in Facebook over privacy, as the firm ran advertisements in British and U.S. newspapers apologizing to users.

headline.print_headline: Polls Show Facebook Losing Trust as Firm Uses Ads to Apologize
headline.main: Polls Show Facebook Losing Trust as Firm Uses Ads to Apologize

docs.snippet: The website said that the bill, which removes protections from liability for facilitating trafficking, made it too risky to maintain its personal ads.

headline.main: Missed Connections: Craigslist Drops Personal Ads Because of Sex Trafficking Bill

docs.snippet: A Saudi prince sells his triplex at Heritage at Trump Place for $30 million; Jon Bon Jovi and Seth Meyers each sell West Village condos.

headline.print_headline: A Triplex Fit for a Prince, and Owned by One, Finally Sells
headline.main: Triplex Fit for a Prince, and Owned by One, Finally Sells

headline.main: Kim Jong-un, Kashmir, Gaza Strip: Your Monday Briefing

docs.snippet: The United States rejected 100 Iranians, mainly members of Christian minorities, who had applied for refugee status under a law offering religious protections.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Closes Door on Christians Who Fled Iran
headline.main: Spurned by U.S. and Facing Danger Back Home, Iranian Christians Fear the Worst

docs.snippet: Russians had wondered before Mr. Putin’s speech what he planned for his last term, and they got an answer: Russia will be a superpower again.

headline.print_headline: Putin Says He Has ‘Invincible’ Nuclear Missile
headline.main: Putin’s ‘Invincible’ Missile Is Aimed at U.S. Vulnerabilities

docs.snippet: Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak's government tabled a bill in parliament on Monday outlawing "fake news", with hefty fines and up to 10 years in jail, raising more concern about media freedom in the wake of a multi-billion dollar graft scanda...

headline.print_headline: Malaysia Proposes Jail for Up to 10 Years, Fines for 'Fake News'
headline.main: Malaysia Proposes Jail for Up to 10 Years, Fines for 'Fake News'

docs.snippet: Senators Amy Klobuchar, Steve Daines, Dianne Feinstein and others mixed facts and falsehoods in their televised talk with President Trump.

headline.print_headline: Lots of Talk on Policy Among Lawmakers, Not All of It Quite Right
headline.main: Republican and Democratic Lawmakers Get Facts Wrong on Gun Policy

headline.main: Brexit, Hope Hicks, Neymar: Your Thursday Briefing

docs.snippet: The magazines, some of the most celebrated titles in the industry, clashed with the lifestyle publications favored by Meredith, which bought Time Inc. last year.

headline.print_headline: Meredith Plans to Sell Time And 3 Other Magazines
headline.main: Meredith Says It Intends to Sell Time, Sports Illustrated, Fortune and Money
